story:
"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can
change the world; indeed, its the only thing that ever has."        Margaret Mead

Hi!
My name is John Krueger. I'm 66 years young, a native of Chicago, I've spent the past 35 years living in and around Asheville, NC. I've worked in the natural products industry since 1978. I've had a wholesale bakery/sandwich operation, a vegetarian restaurant, I've been a health food store clerk, store manager, vitamin department manager, and as a consultant on a store remodel project.

Over the past 5 years, I've become acquainted with several nontraditional methods for treating cancer...methods that have been successful for people that I know personally. I only wish that I had had this information back in the early nineties when my sister Joan was battling breast cancer. She lost her fight in 1994, when she was only 50.

I'm hoping to establish an information center for alternative cancer treatments, both on the web and a physical place where people can come to get free handouts telling the stories and methods of successful cancer victors. We will hold free talks by some of these successful people, and show health related movies to help educate the public on various health related topics.

I've shared information on alternative cancer treatments with over two hundred people...and I know of several who have used the information to get and stay cancer free. This includes my 76 year old brother who last year avoided a $100,000 radiation bill as his prostate cancer disappeared. I truly wish to continue this work for years to come.

I plan to fund this center with a health food store selling both food and supplements. The store I envision will be about 2,000 square feet, a 2 or 3 person shop profitable enough to support the information center. The location I have found is on the north side of Hendersonville, NC. Henderson county has over 100,000 people year round. This increases between May and October with summer residents and tourists. It's on a high traffic road with over 35 upscale subdivisions within 4 miles. This should allow us to quickly develop a sufficient customer base to self sustaining.
 
If any one out there would like to see some of the inspiring stories, (and get details as to how they were successful) please email me at krugs1249@gmail.com. I'll be happy to send you the information promptly!

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $300,000. This will buy all the coolers, freezers, register, nut butter machines, shelving, end-caps, counters, outside signs, and about $75,000 in opening inventory. We'll also need a flat screen TV/DVD and some audio equipment so that we can show movies and have speakers. There will be software bills and electrician bills as well. I belong to my church maintenance crew, so we shouldn't have painting or shelving assembly costs (other than pizza and beer!). I'm planning on having six months of rent, utilities, and payroll in reserve at opening.
 
If enough contributors take advantage of their perks, we'll easily meet our monthly obligations. Dig those discounts! Check out our win-win perks! If you spend $100 in supplements (like I do), and you contribute $100, after 5 months you'll have recouped your investment, and you'll begin making money from then on! Those willing to invest $500 earn a 30% discount, and recoup their investment after 17 months. This way we're both making money while helping people!
 
Should contributions fall short of our $300K goal we could eliminate the grocery section, and just sell supplements, protein bars, and cold ice tea (we are in the south after all). This would save about 1/2 the opening cost by eliminating coolers, freezers, nut butter machines, shelving, and about 15K in inventory.
 
We could even start as an online retailer with one website for sales and another for alternative cancer information. There are lots of options, depending on what support we get.

Main Focus - to Share Info About Successful Alternative Cancer Treatments

Regardless of how we start out, the main focus will still be to share information about successful alternative cancer treatments. We can help people in many ways if we have a physical store, but even from the web we can reach around the world.
 
I've seen many success stories over the past 5 years since meeting my friends Liz and Don while a supplement manager in Brevard, NC. Don overcame stage four prostate and bone cancer using only diet and ph control. I've shared his story and methods with over two hundred people since then, and he has generously volunteered to speak at 3 different venues, sharing his story with over 150 additional people.
 
This past year has seen some dramatic results...my friend Roy and my own brother Karl, prostate cancer free. Also, my buddy Eric from church who was kicked out of hospice after eating broccoli sprouts for 3 weeks. He was told to go home; "you're not dying anymore!".
 
My nurse friend Tonya whose breast cancer disappeared after 2 weeks of doing baking soda to raise her ph. Too many more to list here...but not near enough to satisfy me!
 
Ironically the one person I remember the most is a lady from Charleston, SC, who was visiting the NC mountains for the weekend. While talking with her as she browsed my supplement department she confided that she had never eaten a meal in her whole life without pain from mouth ulcers. Can you imagine! So I talked to her about L-Lysine and she purchased a bottle. A year past, and she showed up again and identified herself. Once she mentioned her condition I of course remembered her. She said she came back to NC just to thank me...she tearfully said "you've changed my life!" Wow! Not lifesaving, but...Wow! I'll never forget her. What a gift to be able to have a positive impact like that on someone's life!

Risks & Challenges

With any venture comes risk. This proposed venture is no exception. Hendersonville has a popular, recently expanded food Coop on the opposite side of town. Howevever, our store will be a lot closer to 35 upscale subdivisions than the coop, we'll offer senior discounts which the co-op does not, and because of the uniqueness of our cancer information center, we expect that people will seek us out.

The high visibility of our location, direct mail ads, and press releases should also help us to develop a customer base quickly. The knowledge and honesty of our staff will keep them coming back.
 
I've been through two store openings and one total store remodel project. I know this will be a lot of work. Happily, I've had several offers to join this project, and have selected two former co-workers to join the team. I've spoken with several vitamin reps who are ready to not only give us deals but help with set up as well. Thankfully we'll have a host of friends and family as volunteers to ease the load on us as well.

So please... Help us help others if you can!

Tell your friends and family about this campaign that seeks to reach out a helping hand to the world from our humble little store nestled in these beautiful mountains.
 
Indiegogo has various tools to help spread the word... we encourage you to check them out if you are so inspired. And thanks for checking us out!

story:
Invest in the future women's health while honoring a trailblazer and dedicated physician

By investing in the Gloria E. Sarto Professorship you are investing in the future of women's health equity, and all the promise that equity in health care provides to women, their families, their communities and the future. By investing in this professorship you are investing in the great institution that nurtured and supported Dr. Sarto and gave her the intellectual foundation to trust in the belief that one compassionate and dedicated person can make a significant difference in the world.

Our goal and your investment

This Indiegogo campaign is a seed for a larger goal of a $1 million endowed professorship. Many dedicated supporters have already invested $400,000, AND between now and June 5, 2015, two generous donors have offered to match every dollar you invest in the future of women's health and health equity research. That means our $25,000 goal will become $50,000. No matter how much we raise through Indiegogo, every dollar will be added to the Sarto Professorship fund.

In addition to the satisfaction you'll take from investing...we are pleased to offer several tokens of our appreciation at various levels of giving. These range from small mementos of Dr. Sarto's astonishing career as a leader in women's health, to opportunities to meet and interact with the scientists whose work is built on the foundation that Dr. Sarto laid, to dinner with Dr. Sarto herself at Madison's premier restaurant.

The lasting impact of the Sarto Professorship

To honor and ensure the work and legacy of this extraordinary woman continues in perpetuity we have created a $1 million endowment fund to establish the Gloria E. Sarto, MD, PhD, Professorship in Women's Health and Health Equity Research.  This professorship will allow us to recruit and retain the top physician or researcher whose work is focused on advancing women’s health through health equity research. We are a leader in this area because Dr. Sarto has called the University of Wisconsin-Madison her academic home for most of her life.

Endowed professorships have become an essential tool in advancing the mission of the UW-Madison School of Medicine and Public Health.  They not only help us recruit and retain the top scholars in any field of study, they provide critical annual funding for research. 

Testimonials about Dr. Sarto

Congresswoman Patricia Schroeder, Member of the US House of Representative from Colorado 1973–1997:

"Dr. Sarto is indeed a pioneer.  Senator Olympia Snowe (R-Maine) and I (D-Colorado) co-chaired the Congressional Caucus on Women's Issues and had quite a battle getting women's health taken seriously by the NIH and our colleagues.  Those in the field of medicine, like Dr. Sarto, were brave to step up and say they were willing to run the office of Women's Health at NIH.  Their male colleagues were totally against it and thought we were politicizing medical science.  It’s important to remind people how brave she was and important in the advancement of research by the NIH, which would benefit women's health in the future."

Carol T., patient:

"I was very fortunate to be a participant in Dr. Sarto's pioneering research on the fertility drug Clomid more than 45 years ago.  She inspired my utmost confidence and trust by her expertise, her personal presence, and her communication style that treated me with consideration and respect.

"Consequently were able to realize the fulfillment of two beloved children and six grandchildren that my husband and I would not have experienced without Dr. Sarto's expert intervention.  Throughout these years, I remember Dr. Sarto with fondness and deep appreciation."

story:
The Liberia Marathon is a professional running race in the West African country Liberia, organized by Liberian and international volunteers. 

In 2014 we were forced to cancel the annual marathon due to the Ebola outbreak in West Africa.  After the epidemic has finally been kicked out of the country, we are now preparing for the race 2015.
Support our efforts to make an epic Liberia Marathon 2015 reality!

Every day you can see a group of Liberian runners speeding along side Duport Road, a jam-packed and congested road that travels from Red Light market to down town Monrovia. They maneuver in-between fully packed yellow taxi’s, endure the blazing sun or  the infamous heavy West African rain, to train for the annual Liberia Marathon. The first marathon was launched in 2011 and has been a big success ever since. Due to the Ebola outbreak the past year’s Marathon was postponed, leaving many of the runners disappointed. Now Liberia has been declared Ebola free, the Liberian marathon team is ready to start again! 

LIBERIA MARATHON 2015 –A NEW BEGINNING!


The idea behind the Liberian Marathon is simple: to show Liberia and the world that Liberia is more than Ebola, and more than the 14 horrible years of civil wars that haunted this country. Instead, the Liberia marathon team looks forward, towards a new beginning for a Liberia for Liberians. 

In the midst of planning the 2015 marathon, Ebola struck. Any gathering of a larger group of people was no longer safe and prohibited by the President. Additionally, the medical security of our runners could not be guaranteed anymore. With heavy hearts the team postponed the marathon and now –after Liberia has officially been declared Ebola free–the excitement and the passion for the race is reawakened. We are ready to plan our race for November 8th, 2015.

Why should you support the Liberian Marathon? Our team consists of volunteers that take time on the weekend, after work, and any spare minute in between to work towards race day. Despite all great volunteer work, a race still costs money. To ensure safety, medical tents are set up along the race track, bananas and water handed out, and a chip timing system is installed. To ensure everyone is able to run, the registration fees are kept extremely low.  This is why we depend on external support and why we depend on you.  

We are ready to start organizing the 2015 Marathon - but need your support! Donate and help us celebrate Liberia, its people, and the binding force of running! Donate and kick the Liberia Marathon 2015 off its feet!


LIBERIA MARATHON 2015 – A NEW BEGINNING!

story:
From the Park to a Patented Product

  • Abdon Placide is the inventor of the VDip Power Station
  • The VDip PowerStation was created from Abdon's passion for calisthenics and his search to maximize his workout.
  • From using the fences of the neighborhood park to moving bedroom furniture to 90 degrees to achieve the perfect dip exercise; Abdon set out to create a machine to help others achieve the perfect home fitness unit.
  • From an idea, to prototype, to a utility patent; the VDip Power Station was born & now is ready to enter the marketplace!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need your help to launch the VDip Power Movement.
  • As a community, the VDip Power Movement will help others achieve their maximum workout potential from their home or apartment.
  • We're asking for everyone to join the VDip Power Movement, whether by cash contribution or spreading the word.
  • The VDip Power Station Deluxe is a full unit, with the bench & resistance training bands to unlock all exercises. 
  • Our goal is to sell out our first shipment of units in prep of the following shipment.

The Impact

  • Help Abdon achieve his dream of launching this product; inspired by the fitness legend, Vince Gironda 
  • By backing this project, you are helping revolutionize the potential of home fitness equipment

Risks & Challenges

  • There are a multitude of home fitness equipment options; however there is no home fitness unit like the VDip Power Station. 
  • As a new product entering the marketplace, brand recognition is a hurdle the VDip Power Movement community can tackle together.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the Word
  • Follow & Share on Social Media 
  • Become a member of the VDip Power Movement

We're asking for everyone to join the VDip Power Movement, whether by cash contribution or spreading the word.
The VDip Power Station Deluxe is a full unit, with the bench & resistance training bands to unlock all exercises. 
Our goal is to sell out our first shipment of units in prep of the following shipment.


The Impact

Help Abdon achieve his dream of launching this product; inspired by the fitness legend, Vince Gironda 
By backing this project, you are helping revolutionize the potential of home fitness equipment


Risks & Challenges

There are a multitude of home fitness equipment options; however there is no home fitness unit like the VDip Power Station. 
As a new product entering the marketplace, brand recognition is a hurdle the VDip Power Movement community can tackle together.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word
Follow & Share on Social Media 
Become a member of the VDip Power Movement

story:
What is Yalah Yoga?

In case the video didn't load.

Jade created the Yalah Yoga brand in 2015. With the intention of always building a studio, she started with freelance classes in Morocco, offering a fun and relatable style of vinyasa yoga to anyone willing to join: tourists, expats and locals. After two years of building the brand, Jade and her partner Ouifaq are ready to open doors in Marrakech for women to discover and deepen their yoga practice, and build a cool community in the process. 

All women of all backgrounds will be welcomed into our studio, where it will be more about sharing experiences than ending up trying to impress anybody. We want everyone to feel real and true so they can experience the opportunity for self expression and through this journey, build self confidence and acceptance. 

We want to liberate women through yoga. 

Who are we?

Two friends, girl bosses, one dream. 

#sistersaredoingitforthemselves

Why We Care

BECAUSE YOGA ISN'T JUST ABOUT SERVING YOURSELF

We understand the struggle. 

As daily practitioners, we see the need firsthand for a space that will encourage yoga and its further teachings to women that truly want to be a part of a yoga community. We also feel that yoga shouldn't just be accessible for the ultra-chic or expat subsets. We're opening the doors to all women, and making it financially possible for them to join. Think: affordable and multi-lingual community classes, events, workshops, and volunteer opportunities for teachers to bring yoga to the mothers and daughters of rural Morocco. 

What We Need to Get Started

Our goal is to raise $5k in funds to jump start our studio. Because we're both overachievers and we know that realistically, it will take more than that, we aim to raise double that within September and October. Our immediate needs are legal/administrative fees, real estate and equipment. With low overhead operational costs, we also plan to offer discounted pre-sale memberships to clients eager to join the studio when it opens in mid-December. 

What you contribute goes directly to the development of something that is not only dear to our hearts, but it goes to the development of a community of women who will empower, support, and learn from one another. Why women-only? We'll occasionally offer classes for guys to experience as well, but we specifically want to create a space where women can practice freely, to get to know themselves, their minds and their bodies more, and to get to know each other. Also, because girl power. 

We do believe that both men and women are complimentary, and each part relies on the other. However, in such a cultural context, we noticed in our previous experiences that women have yet to obtain a space where they can truly be comfortable and explorative in their yoga practice without the discomfort of perception. 

What We Need and What You Get

The break down in more detail: 

  • Only 5k can get our doors open by December! But we aim higher...

  • 10k will see us open with better equipment, more options for classes and teachers
  • 15k will drive us into a whole new realm, allowing us to provide awesome perks to our members like aerial yoga swings, additional fitness equipment and course, and regular events for our members 
  • Donations of any amount are invaluable and we can't even begin to express our gratitude. A little bit goes a long way, and we'll keep you in the loop during the whole process of how this money is being spent.
  • We also offer perks for our backers! Check it out.

  • $5 gets you a sweet social media shoutout and your name on our Yalah Yoga wall of gratitude when the studio opens
  • $10 gets you a super cool handmade tassle keychain, straight from Marrakech
  • $20 gets you a cozy pair of Moroccan leather slippers, so you can keep your feet stylin'
  • $50 gets you a sweet little care package from us with some Yalah Yoga goodies and a whole lotta gratitude
  • $120 gets you a sweet Moroccan carpet for your home
  • $250 gets you a goody bag filled with Moroccan treasures (leather slippers, tea cups, baskets, spices & more) delivered right to your doorstep - no matter where you are in the world
  • $500 gets you an even bigger goody bag with the above-mentioned treasure plus more, including a sweet little hand-woven Moroccan carpet, hammam towels, and a few more home goods to enjoy
  • $1000 gets you a lifetime membership at Yalah Yoga - the perfect perk for a local yogini!
  • $1500 gets you a 3 days/2 nights trip to the Moroccan Sahara for 2, plus a collection of Moroccan goodies that we'll personally source for you

But Wait, There's More

Are you local to Marrakech and want to become part of the Yalah Yoga Community? Back our campaign by participating in our first month membership pre-sale!

Pay your first month's membership fees in advance to help us open the doors sooner! At a one-time introductory rate of $60 for your first month, this is a great deal for unlimited yoga! (Hint: guys, this is also a great gift for the yoga ladies in your family!)

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help support the campaign. We kindly ask for your help by getting the word out! Share the campaign link with your network and help us get noticed by making some noise. Our campaign is shareable via social media, email, and old fashioned copy/paste. We love your support!

Find us on Facebook

Find us on Instagram

Find us on the Web

story:
A Campaign to Sustain: Holistic Health Solutions

    Blending a unique array of knowledge that spans the globe, our team of Health Experts and Sustainability Professionals is dedicated to aiding in the transformation of those who seek to improve their health, and that of the the planet as well. From optimizing personal dieting techniques and sustainability, to rejuvenating and healing the body and mind, we hope to provide efficient and effective holistic solutions to combat some of our collective ills. A few of the fields in which our group specializes in include optimizing health through all-natural means, residential and commercial sustainability, as well as unique research in the fields of consciousness and expanding awareness. We believe that changing the world begins at the personal level and seek to exchange information in an open forum structure so that we can continue to create collective solutions to our most fundamental issues. 

Reason for Presenting

      The overarching goal for this funding is to implement projects and create a storefront for sustainable goods and health workshops, dedicated to easy and effective dieting techniques and commercial/residential sustainability. We would also like to provide free webinars on our website, in addition to our currently available free e-books (http://urbanshamaninsight.wix.com/thrive#!healt...) and online store (www.SustainableLiving.Solutions). Classes and educational topics would focus on the following subjects:

  • Health: Daily Dieting issues, Superfoods, Detoxifying Cleanse Techniques, Food as Medicine and Natural Cancer Cures, Healthy Vegetarianism, Aging and Longevity, Raw Food Dieting, the Human Energy System (Chakras, Kundalini, Pineal Gland, Meditation, Yoga, Tai Chi, Sun Gazing, etc.) Organic Farming (Proper Nutrition, Urban Farming Techniques, Algae Farming (Spirulina and Chlorella), Exercise Techniques, etc.
  • Consciousness: (Evolution of Consciousness, Meditation, Awakening the Pineal Gland, Expanding Awareness, etc.)
  • Green Building and Sustainability: (Environmental Impact and Repair Strategies, Residential/Industrial Sustainability)
  • Healing: Healing of the Mind and Body
  • Areas of Future Growth

story:
Please scroll down for English

20 Temmuz 2015 Pazartesi günü öğle saatlerinde Urfa’nın Suruç ilçesinden gelen haberle sarsıldık. Kobane’nin yeniden inşasına destek olmak için Suruç üzerinden Kobane’ye geçmek üzere olan yaklaşık 200 kişilik bir grup, yola çıkmadan hemen önce Suruç merkezdeki Amara Kültür Merkezi’nde yaptıkları basın açıklaması sırasından bombalı saldırıya uğradı. Canlı bomba saldırısı sonucu 31 arkadaşımızı, kardeşimizi kaybettik.

Saldırının üzerinden yaklaşık iki hafta geçti. Halen 17 arkadaşımız hastanede, ikisinin durumu ciddiyetini koruyor, hayati tehlike sürüyor.

Bizler, bu saldırıyı kendimize yapılmış sayanlar, hayatta kalan arkadaşlarımızın yaşam şartlarıyla ilgili endişeliyiz. Her birinin, her gün yeni bir ihtiyacı oluyor, ailelerinin maddi durumları ihtiyaçları karşılamak için yeterli değil. Devlet, sosyal bir devletin üstlenmesi gereken sorumlulukları üstlenmiyor. Patlama sonucu çok ağır yaralanan, uzuvlarını, hareket kabiliyetlerini yitiren arkadaşlarımız var. Arkadaşlarımız Suruç’ta, Samsun’da, Antakya’da, Ankara’da, Antep’de, Diyarbakır’da, Malatya’da ve İstanbul’da hastanelerde. Aileler çocuklarının başında ancak pek çoğunun maddi kaynakları yeterli değil.

Burada topladığımız parayla ailelerin ve arkadaşlarımızın öncelikli olarak sağlık masraflarına destek olmayı amaçlıyoruz.

Kampanyamıza destek olan herkesle harcamalarla ilgili detaylı bilgiyi e-posta aracılığıyla paylaşacağız. Bu kampanyanın herhangi bir hediyesi yok, elbette her türlü desteğinizin gülümsemeyle ödüllendirileceğine emin olabilirsiniz! Lütfen sesimizi, sözümüzü hashtag’imizle yaymamıza yardımcı olun! #SurucIcinImece

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We were shaken by the news coming out of Suruc, Urfa at around noon on Monday, July 20, 2015. A group of approximately 200 young activists, who were about to cross into neighboring Syrian town of Kobane via Suruc to support and help the reconstruction of Kobane, were attacked by a bomb during a press statement at Amara Cultural Center in Suruc. We lost 31 friends, sisters, brothers in this suicide bomb attack.

It's been almost two weeks since the massacre. 17 of our friends are still in hospital - two of them still in critical condition, their lives still at risk.

We, the people who assume this attack was also targeted at us, are worried about our surviving friends' conditions. Each day brings about new needs and their families cannot financially afford all of these needs. The State does not take the responsibilities expected from a social state. We have friends who were seriously injured, lost their limbs and appendages and with that, their ability to move. Our friends lie in hospitals in Suruc, Samsun, Antakya, Ankara, Antep, Diyarbakir, Malatya and Istanbul. The families are with their children but most of them lack the financial means to support them.

We aim to help our friends and their families primarily cover their medical expenses with the money collected here.
We will share details of the expenditures with everyone supporting our campaign via e-mail. There are no traditional rewards attached to this campaign, but you can be sure that each and every support will receive a heart-felt smile! Please help us spread our voice, our word with the hashtag #SurucIcınImece / #CollectiveHelpForSuruc

story:
Here's a Video About Dee McCaffrey, How HITO Got Started, and How HITO Got Its Name:

 
 

Our Story

Twenty-five years ago, I was an obese junk food junkie, working toward my bachelor’s degree in environmental chemistry.  One day I decided to apply what I learned in the lab to what was on my plate. I gave up processed foods, lost 100 pounds and I’ve never looked back.

After working as an organic chemist for many years, I returned to school, and have been a nutritionist for 15 years. I’ve written the internationally acclaimed book The Science of Skinny, and have appeared on national radio and television.  

Over the years, I have used many software tools to help my clients track their food and help me create individualized meal plans for them based on their needs.  There are plenty of programs that can track food and even show nutritional deficiencies, but none of them give tailored suggestions on how to fill nutrient gaps, and more importantly how to optimize food choices to prevent or manage certain common health conditions.

My business partner, Ernesto Amezcua, had a similar experience.  Himself, his wife and daughters experienced weight and health problems.  After spending hundreds of dollars on specialized tests to determine his disease risks and nutritional deficiencies, the testing laboratory sent him an impersonal report that provided plenty of colorful pages filled with general information about food, but little guidance on what specifically to eat and why.

Together, we wanted to create a program that would allow people to track their food intake and get instant feedback with the same excellent education and specific recommendations a personal nutritionist would give them, plus a lot more.  Ernesto has the background in business intelligence and software creation, and I have the nutrition knowledge.  

We decided to collaborate on creating something that’s never been done before, thus there is no other nutrition app, food tracker or professional nutrition analysis software that can do what HITO does.

As you are well aware, obesity is a worldwide epidemic. But even people who are normal weight are needlessly suffering from diet-related illnesses like diabetes, heart disease and cancer, simply because they are not educated about food and its ability to hurt or help their body.  

By helping us bring HITO to life, your contribution will revolutionize the way people eat, and as a result, improve millions of lives.

Pledges & Perks

We are so close, yet so far away. According to our estimates, we need $10,000 to pay the programmers to finish the project, and we need a small army of beta-testers. That’s where you come in!

For just a $10 pledge, you can be one of our valuable beta-testers, giving us necessary feedback on how it’s working before we launch.  You’ll also get a one-month subscription to HITO after we launch. For a $5,000 pledge, you’ll get a lifetime subscription to HITO and much more.  We’re expecting to exceed the goal, and any extra money will go into our budget for future expenses.

To further help us reach our goal, we appreciate having you spread the word to everyone you know about this important project.

 

KEY FEATURES OF HITO

 

Choose an Established Diet, or Customize Your Own

HITO has been programmed with food guidelines and made-for-you menus that meet the criteria for several common diets, OR you can choose to create and customize your own balanced meal plans.  If you're not sure which diet plan is right for you, HITO can suggest one for you based on information you provide about your health goals.

If you are already following the Atkins Diet, Paleo, The Science of Skinny (Processed-Free) Eating Plan, Intermittent Fasting (The 5:2 Diet), South Beach, The Zone Diet, or several others, you should feel at home, because each of these diet plans are integrated into HITO.

Each food item in our database has been correlated for the various diet plans and phases of each plan, so if you're on Atkins Phase 1,  or South Beach Phase 2, you'll easily be able to search for the foods, recipes and menus that are suitable for your selected diet plan.

If you're not following an established plan and want to track food and make your own meal plans, HITO can help make recommendations to help you optimize your food choices.

 

Personalize Your Meal Plan

HITO has much more power and flexibility than just one singular diet plan.  Suppose you want to follow the main guidelines of the The Science of Skinny (Processed-Free) Eating Plan, but you also want to go gluten-free, vegetarian, AND you want to eat the best foods for your blood type. HITO gives you the option to narrow your food searches so you'll only see the foods that are suitable to your particular eating plan and health goals.

 

A Highly Intelligent Food Database

The power of HITO lies in it's food database, which contains over 8,000 entries providing information far beyond the standard calories, fats, carbs, proteins, vitamins and minerals,  so that it can intelligently correlate foods to meet your specific nutritional needs.

Are you doing your best to follow a balanced diet, but want to know which foods can help with your arthritis or lower your cholesterol?  With just a click of a button, HITO will show you the foods you want to see, and filter out the ones that are not helpful to you.

Each food item in the database has been individually tagged for specific criteria, such as:  

  • It is among the top 100 known Superfoods
  • Which diet and phase of diet it is good for
  • Which health conditions it has been scientifically proven to help or hinder (for example if you have arthritis, it's best to avoid tomatoes and peppers and focus on turmeric)
  • Which phytonutrients it contains (beta-carotene, lycopene, etc.)
  • Which blood type it is suited for (according to the book "Eat Right for Your Blood Type")
  • Alkaline forming or acid forming
  • Low, medium or high glycemic
  • Type of carbohydrate it contains (refined or unrefined)
  • Processed-free (contains no refined sugar, flour or chemical additives)
  • Gluten-free
  • Allergy-free (soy, egg and dairy)
  • And many other identifiers

HITO's food database is also categorized according to foods of particular interest, for example the fruits are categorized by berries, citrus, and melons, and the vegetables are categorized by dark green leafy, non-starchy, starchy, cruciferous, and nightshades.  This makes it easy for you to make sure you're getting all the right types of fruits and veggies into your meal plans.

Other foods, such as legumes, whole grains, nuts, seeds, and dairy products also have specified categories to help you find foods easily.

 

The "Ad Hoc" Feature:  Get Recommendations Just Like Having a Personal Nutritionist

Hito's powerful database allows for an impressive feature we call "Ad Hoc."  Ad hoc literally means "for this" in Latin, and in English it means "for this specific purpose."  The Ad Hoc feature tailors food and nutrient recommendations for you--just like having a personal nutritionist!

When you track food intake and/or create meal plans, HITO uses the information you've provided in your user profile (such as age, gender, health goals, stress level, family history for disease risk, etc.) and then analyzes your food choices to make sure you're meeting all of your nutritional requirements for your specific needs.

Not getting enough vitamin E and iron to meet your daily needs?  HITO shows you a list of foods that not only contain vitamin E and iron, but ALSO makes sure they meet the requirements of your chosen diet plan.

Are you a 30-year old female with a high stress job who also wants to lower cholesterol and release 20 pounds?  HITO's Ad Hoc feature will also show you a list of foods that contain nutrients needed to combat stress, lower cholesterol, boost metabolism and balance blood sugar to help release weight and help you fill your nutrients gaps so you can optimize your health.

If you have a fitness wearable such as a Fitbit or Withings device, it can be integrated with HITO to track your activity level---then HITO can recommend the foods that contain the nutrients you need to help optimize your workouts.

 

Get Your Shopping List in a Jiffy!

Once you select your foods and meals for the week, and have all of your Ad hoc information, HITO will instantly create a shopping list for you. You won’t even need to print it (but you can if you like) because it’s all on your phone!

 

Do Your Best to Avoid Common Health Issues

When you complete your user profile, you have the option to let HITO know what your health concerns are and your family history for disease risk. Do you or your family members have any common disease risks?

If so, HITO's intelligent database is equipped to help you select the best scientifically proven foods to fend off your symptoms and risks.   If you have diabetes, HITO will suggest foods for stabilizing your blood sugar levels. Worried about developing Alzheimer’s? HITO will provide you with a list of foods that are scientifically proven to help prevent the disease. High Cholesterol? No problem, HITO's got you covered by suggesting foods that are known to help lower cholesterol. 

Compare Foods in a Flash!

Want to know which food has more phytonutrients? How about which food has more protein, vitamins, fiber or fat? Our Compare Foods tool gives you the answer in seconds.

 

Food Education: Knowledge is Power

The HITO team is dedicated to improving the health of people everywhere.  From our own experience, we know that diet and lifestyle changes are difficult to sustain without knowledge about food and nutrition.  That's why HITO is not just a way to track food and nutrients--it's an educational guide designed to arm you with the knowledge and skills for lifelong healthy eating.

Through a growing library of educational videos and on-screen pop-ups, HITO teaches you nutrition basics and keeps you up to date on the best ways to improve and maintain your health.
story_txt:
Here's a Video About Dee McCaffrey, How HITO Got Started, and How HITO Got Its Name:
 

 
Our Story
Twenty-five years ago, I was an obese junk food junkie, working toward my bachelor’s degree in environmental chemistry.  One day I decided to apply what I learned in the lab to what was on my plate. I gave up processed foods, lost 100 pounds and I’ve never looked back.
After working as an organic chemist for many years, I returned to school, and have been a nutritionist for 15 years. I’ve written the internationally acclaimed book The Science of Skinny, and have appeared on national radio and television.  
Over the years, I have used many software tools to help my clients track their food and help me create individualized meal plans for them based on their needs.  There are plenty of programs that can track food and even show nutritional deficiencies, but none of them give tailored suggestions on how to fill nutrient gaps, and more importantly how to optimize food choices to prevent or manage certain common health conditions.
My business partner, Ernesto Amezcua, had a similar experience.  Himself, his wife and daughters experienced weight and health problems.  After spending hundreds of dollars on specialized tests to determine his disease risks and nutritional deficiencies, the testing laboratory sent him an impersonal report that provided plenty of colorful pages filled with general information about food, but little guidance on what specifically to eat and why.
Together, we wanted to create a program that would allow people to track their food intake and get instant feedback with the same excellent education and specific recommendations a personal nutritionist would give them, plus a lot more.  Ernesto has the background in business intelligence and software creation, and I have the nutrition knowledge.  
We decided to collaborate on creating something that’s never been done before, thus there is no other nutrition app, food tracker or professional nutrition analysis software that can do what HITO does.
As you are well aware, obesity is a worldwide epidemic. But even people who are normal weight are needlessly suffering from diet-related illnesses like diabetes, heart disease and cancer, simply because they are not educated about food and its ability to hurt or help their body.  
By helping us bring HITO to life, your contribution will revolutionize the way people eat, and as a result, improve millions of lives.

Pledges & Perks
We are so close, yet so far away. According to our estimates, we need $10,000 to pay the programmers to finish the project, and we need a small army of beta-testers. That’s where you come in!
For just a $10 pledge, you can be one of our valuable beta-testers, giving us necessary feedback on how it’s working before we launch.  You’ll also get a one-month subscription to HITO after we launch. For a $5,000 pledge, you’ll get a lifetime subscription to HITO and much more.  We’re expecting to exceed the goal, and any extra money will go into our budget for future expenses.
To further help us reach our goal, we appreciate having you spread the word to everyone you know about this important project.
 
KEY FEATURES OF HITO
 
Choose an Established Diet, or Customize Your Own

HITO has been programmed with food guidelines and made-for-you menus that meet the criteria for several common diets, OR you can choose to create and customize your own balanced meal plans.  If you're not sure which diet plan is right for you, HITO can suggest one for you based on information you provide about your health goals.
If you are already following the Atkins Diet, Paleo, The Science of Skinny (Processed-Free) Eating Plan, Intermittent Fasting (The 5:2 Diet), South Beach, The Zone Diet, or several others, you should feel at home, because each of these diet plans are integrated into HITO.
Each food item in our database has been correlated for the various diet plans and phases of each plan, so if you're on Atkins Phase 1,  or South Beach Phase 2, you'll easily be able to search for the foods, recipes and menus that are suitable for your selected diet plan.
If you're not following an established plan and want to track food and make your own meal plans, HITO can help make recommendations to help you optimize your food choices.
 
Personalize Your Meal Plan

HITO has much more power and flexibility than just one singular diet plan.  Suppose you want to follow the main guidelines of the The Science of Skinny (Processed-Free) Eating Plan, but you also want to go gluten-free, vegetarian, AND you want to eat the best foods for your blood type. HITO gives you the option to narrow your food searches so you'll only see the foods that are suitable to your particular eating plan and health goals.
 
A Highly Intelligent Food Database

The power of HITO lies in it's food database, which contains over 8,000 entries providing information far beyond the standard calories, fats, carbs, proteins, vitamins and minerals,  so that it can intelligently correlate foods to meet your specific nutritional needs.
Are you doing your best to follow a balanced diet, but want to know which foods can help with your arthritis or lower your cholesterol?  With just a click of a button, HITO will show you the foods you want to see, and filter out the ones that are not helpful to you.
Each food item in the database has been individually tagged for specific criteria, such as:  

It is among the top 100 known Superfoods
Which diet and phase of diet it is good for
Which health conditions it has been scientifically proven to help or hinder (for example if you have arthritis, it's best to avoid tomatoes and peppers and focus on turmeric)
Which phytonutrients it contains (beta-carotene, lycopene, etc.)
Which blood type it is suited for (according to the book "Eat Right for Your Blood Type")
Alkaline forming or acid forming
Low, medium or high glycemic
Type of carbohydrate it contains (refined or unrefined)
Processed-free (contains no refined sugar, flour or chemical additives)
Gluten-free
Allergy-free (soy, egg and dairy)
And many other identifiers

HITO's food database is also categorized according to foods of particular interest, for example the fruits are categorized by berries, citrus, and melons, and the vegetables are categorized by dark green leafy, non-starchy, starchy, cruciferous, and nightshades.  This makes it easy for you to make sure you're getting all the right types of fruits and veggies into your meal plans.
Other foods, such as legumes, whole grains, nuts, seeds, and dairy products also have specified categories to help you find foods easily.
 

The "Ad Hoc" Feature:  Get Recommendations Just Like Having a Personal Nutritionist

Hito's powerful database allows for an impressive feature we call "Ad Hoc."  Ad hoc literally means "for this" in Latin, and in English it means "for this specific purpose."  The Ad Hoc feature tailors food and nutrient recommendations for you--just like having a personal nutritionist!
When you track food intake and/or create meal plans, HITO uses the information you've provided in your user profile (such as age, gender, health goals, stress level, family history for disease risk, etc.) and then analyzes your food choices to make sure you're meeting all of your nutritional requirements for your specific needs.
Not getting enough vitamin E and iron to meet your daily needs?  HITO shows you a list of foods that not only contain vitamin E and iron, but ALSO makes sure they meet the requirements of your chosen diet plan.
Are you a 30-year old female with a high stress job who also wants to lower cholesterol and release 20 pounds?  HITO's Ad Hoc feature will also show you a list of foods that contain nutrients needed to combat stress, lower cholesterol, boost metabolism and balance blood sugar to help release weight and help you fill your nutrients gaps so you can optimize your health.
If you have a fitness wearable such as a Fitbit or Withings device, it can be integrated with HITO to track your activity level---then HITO can recommend the foods that contain the nutrients you need to help optimize your workouts.
 
Get Your Shopping List in a Jiffy!

Once you select your foods and meals for the week, and have all of your Ad hoc information, HITO will instantly create a shopping list for you. You won’t even need to print it (but you can if you like) because it’s all on your phone!
 

Do Your Best to Avoid Common Health Issues

When you complete your user profile, you have the option to let HITO know what your health concerns are and your family history for disease risk. Do you or your family members have any common disease risks?
If so, HITO's intelligent database is equipped to help you select the best scientifically proven foods to fend off your symptoms and risks.   If you have diabetes, HITO will suggest foods for stabilizing your blood sugar levels. Worried about developing Alzheimer’s? HITO will provide you with a list of foods that are scientifically proven to help prevent the disease. High Cholesterol? No problem, HITO's got you covered by suggesting foods that are known to help lower cholesterol. 
Compare Foods in a Flash!

Want to know which food has more phytonutrients? How about which food has more protein, vitamins, fiber or fat? Our Compare Foods tool gives you the answer in seconds.
 
Food Education: Knowledge is Power

The HITO team is dedicated to improving the health of people everywhere.  From our own experience, we know that diet and lifestyle changes are difficult to sustain without knowledge about food and nutrition.  That's why HITO is not just a way to track food and nutrients--it's an educational guide designed to arm you with the knowledge and skills for lifelong healthy eating.
Through a growing library of educational videos and on-screen pop-ups, HITO teaches you nutrition basics and keeps you up to date on the best ways to improve and maintain your health.

story:
On Indiegogo, .... 

You may feel like a drop in the bucket. But every drop counts!

(Click here for Vietnamese version)

Short Summary

Hi everyone, this is VietxNepal speaking! VietxNepal is a fundraising project for Nepal after the double earthquakes on April 25th and May 15th 2015, initiated by 4 high school students in Vietnam and the United States. Proudly presented as a key project in a fundraising campaign founded by Summit Education Service (Hanoi,Vietnam), VietxNepal storms in Indiegogo and takes over it as the main crowdfunding platform for the project!  

Why we start this campaign  

Nepal earthquake, also known as the Gorkha earthquake, with a magnitude of 7.8Mw, on April 25 has left behind many devastating consequences to the people of this nation. According to The Guardian, until now, the total death toll has climbed over 8000, along with 16000 injured and 30000 building destroyed. A magnitude 7.4 aftershock struck Nepal 17 days later on May 12, further exacerbated the conditions there. Therefore, VietxNepal is founded with the purpose of encouraging the Vietnamese to make certain donations to Nepal via fundraising channel. 

Who We Are 

 Tran Phuong Thao (Chloe) - Co-founder of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing     High School Diploma at St. Anthony's High School (Long Island, NY)  

 Dao Nguyet Anh, Co-founder of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing High School              Diploma at Chu Van An National High School for the Gifted (Hanoi, Vietnam)

Pham Thi Lam Phuong, Co-founder of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing High            School Diploma at Chu Van National High School for the Gifted (Hanoi, Vietnam)

 Ta Thuy Linh, Co-founder of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing High School Diploma at Chu Van National High School for the Gifted (Hanoi, Vietnam)

 Nguyen Ngoc Thi Tho, Program Associate of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing High School Diploma at Chu Van National High School for the Gifted (Hanoi, Vietnam)

 Le Thai Hoang Nam, Program Associate of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing High School Diploma at Chu Van National High School for the Gifted (Hanoi, Vietnam) 

 Bui Thanh Ha, Designer of VietxNepal. Currently pursuing High School Diploma at Chu Van National High School for the Gifted (Hanoi, Vietnam)

 Do Bac Dat, Tech Associate of VietxNepal. St.Anthony's High School Class of 2015, Wentworth Institute of Technology Class of 2019. 

 Le Ba Hoang, Advisor of VietxNepal.  La Salle University Class of 2018. 

What We Need & What You Get

VietxNepal has a fundraising goal of 1000 USD starting from June 6th 2015 to July 31st 2015 . As soon as the campaign comes to an end on Indiegogo, regardless of funding goal completion, every single penny VietxNepal receives on Indiegogo will be remitted in one piece to CARE organization which is present in Nepal at the moment to provide immediate monetary and physical aids for the victims of the double earthquakes. On that note of VietxNepal's authenticity, VietxNepal operates under the protection and supervision of Summit Education Service and legally confirms that VietxNepal is a non-profit project. 
In return to your generous donation, VietxNepal sends out personal thank-you notes and uniquely-designed printable stickers and gives out free tickets to our visual art exhibition "Nepal in the ashes" this July 2015 in Hanoi. And that's not all because VietxNepal has numerous special offers and coupons for cafes and restaurants in Hanoi (Vietnam) too! 

The Impact

VietxNepal strives to create a strong bond between the people of the two countries, raising the awareness of the society on the whole. Furthermore, VietxNepal, founded by a group of youngsters, also wants to express the opinions and confirms the position of Vietnam’s young generation in international affairs. Last but not least, VietxNepal organizes many practical and meaningful activities, promising to enhance one’s life experience. With The “Troubadours” series and the exhibition “Nepal in the Ashes”, the project will provide a multidimensional perspective in art – an essential factor to connect people, despite geographical differences and the diversity of society and culture.
As for 4 co-founders and associates of VietxNepal, despite the evident fact that we are young of age and deficit of ground-work experience, we have the blazing passion and  laborious work ethic to make small changes to the world we are living in. We are consciously aware of Nepal's call for help and actively eager to lend Nepal a helping hand. Though we know our help is of minor significance, we are keen on making this campaign go live and reach its goal. We care and we act - that's what we do. 

Risks & Challenges

There are certain obstacles lying ahead of our way such as failure to meet our fundraising goal and lack of experience in fundraising work. However, we are trying our best to make this campaign work both on Indiegogo and in real life. Despite the outcome, we are happy that we've made it this far! 

Other Ways You Can Help

VietxNepal knows that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. So we are asking you folks to do us some favors : 

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Follow our Blog and Facebook fanpage 
  • Attend our "The Troubadours Sessions" in Hanoi (Vietnam) this June! 
  • Pop by our "Nepal in the ashes" exhibition in Hanoi (Vietnam) this July!                    

And that's all there is to it! We, VietxNepal, love you! 

XOXOXO

story:
Who are we?

               

Seeing Possibilities:

Because of poor crop yields in Kasaka, Zambia, many children in the region were unable to go to school. Due to the dire need to contribute to their farms, most were not encouraged to get an education. With a focus always on producing food, children who did manage to attend school experienced a very high student to teacher ratio and extremely poor learning conditions.

The Enactus team at Lambton College concluded the key to success was developing more secure and predictable farming. Enactus Lambton believed implementing “One Seed,” an innovative farming and entrepreneurship project, would increase corn production, combat food insecurity and create a revenue source to supply resources for the local school.

Taking Action:

The team started by partnering with a Canadian agronomist to develop a three-day workshop on the many differences between their traditional plow farming and modern no-till practices. This workshop taught the farmers the importance of conserving soil moisture, the disadvantages of plowing in drought conditions, proper seed spacing and planting depth and good use of fertilizers.

         

Next, the team sectioned two acres of land on the Kasaka Basic School property, where they helped to implement these new methods with 40,000 seeds of corn. By educating and empowering local farmers to employ more modern and innovative farming practices, harvest yields were five times those of previous years.

Enabling Progress:

By transforming farming practices, the “One Seed” project increased corn production by five times and revenues by seven times, created 41 jobs, started seven small businesses, processed 150 micro loans and generated $623,000 in economic impact.

Education was the next focus for this rural community. The school building has been expanded and a solar lighting system implemented to extend class hours.

Enactus Lambton built two new houses for teachers, allowing the school to hire four new teachers and eliminate a decades old shortage of teachers. Enrolment at the school is up 15% over last year and 15 students are heading to high school.

The Kasaka basic school has gone from the worst ranked school in their district to the number one ranked school – in just two years.

               

What’s Next?

As nursing students, we brought a new element to the One Seed project in rural Zambia. Throughout our first and second trip, we completed a medical needs assessment of the clinic in the village of Kasaka. The conditions were deplorable – no electricity, dirt floor, no running water. The clinic was often out of basic medications and immunizations that are required for babies and children under five. There were cockroaches and termites crawling around the maternity ward and the women expressed their fear of falling asleep and waking up in the morning with bites all over their bodies. The HIV rate is approximately 40% of the population and growing, along with a high percentage of infectious disease, deaths from diarrhea, malaria, and pregnancy related deaths, such as hemorrhage. There are two nurses that manage the clinic and one janitor, who’s primary role is as a pharmacist administering medications.

                


               

In May of 2015, we took our third trip to Zambia, this time exploring another village nearby called Gaali. Our plan was to complete a similar needs assessment as we had done in Kasaka the year prior; however, this clinic was different. It was a 6x10 room with a dirt floor and one small window. That was it – an empty room with nothing. It was used as an outpost clinic, meaning that one nurse traveled here once a month to provide prenatal health care to pregnant women and an immunization clinic. The women, often with young children or pregnant, would walk three hours with no water and  wait outside in either the scorching heat or pouring rain for care once a month. At that moment, our goals shifted. It was clear that there needed to be a medical clinic in Gaali. We met with the community health officials to discuss what they wanted to see in Gaali in terms of healthcare. They all asked for assistance in creating a clinic. We are now planning to build from the ground up in Gaali, creating a medical facility as well as staff housing.

        

We will also continue to help the Kasaka clinic and any extra materials we receive in the process of building the clinic in Gaali, we will provide to the Kasaka clinic. By contributing to this project, you will not only help create a clinic in this area, but develop a sustainable long-term future for the people in this community. Health education, prevention and promotion will all be fundamental in the future of health care for rural Zambia.

What We Need

Our initial goals with the One Seed project have been met and the agricultural side of the project is now taking root in multiple areas of Zambia now. Our new goal is to raise $50,000.00 through crowdfunding to help kick start the complete build of a health clinic in Gaali, Zambia. Every dollar raised goes 100% towards the project and after each trip you can find pictures of us doing the actual work. One Seed is a project made through Enactus Lambton College which is completely student led. As nursing students, we pay our own way to Zambia, Africa with the help of family and friends. Any money fundraised is used for the project with absolutely no overhead costs as Lambton College is self-sustainable.  

The Impact

Once our goal is met, approximately 14,000 lives will have access to adequate health care that otherwise meant walking over 16km for the nearest care (three hours for a healthy adult). Currently, at eight months pregnant, women begin their walking journey to the nearest hospital to stay there until they deliver their baby. Building a clinic in Gaali would completely decrease the over capacitated hospital that is in Monze and provide care to the surrounding area that once was only available by one nurse, once a month.

Risks & Challenges

Multiple issues in the Zambian area are surrounded by start-up costs that are virtually impossible for the community to afford. Our project focus on the initial start-up costs values independent sustainability.
The One Seed project is well respected in the surrounding area of Monze and the focus has previously been on agriculture and education. One Seed has been able to build a rapport with the communities in Monze and in the villages of Kasaka and Gaali. Schools have been built and refurbished and the government has been able to support the changes by integrating more teachers for the education system in Kasaka, Zambia. This is the same outcome we are optimistic for within the medical aspect of the project. Although we have had great success with support in the past, we are still in the midst of ensuring government support is there prior to building the clinic. At present, it seems we are going to get all of the necessary government support.
The focus is now on fundraising for the complete build in Gaali. However, if by chance the government provision is unattainable, the money will be spent on refurbishing the medical clinic in Kasaka. There are many areas the money can be spent within the medical world for this community. In Kasaka, there is a clinic that is currently supported from the government so it will benefit either way. This will include medical equipment, fumigating the insects (cockroaches), building a well for clean uncontaminated water, implementing infection control interventions, beds and ultrasound for antenatal women, medical texts and health teaching for all staff.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a Lambton College student, you can become a member of the team and do the labour with us! We have a variety of students that bring all different qualities to the team from business to nursing to computer programming students. The area in Zambia is in need of many things and we are an educational institute, so teaching and learning is what we do!

Another goal of ours is to receive as many in kind donations (Medical equipment) as possible. Part of our fundraising cost will eventually go towards shipping a sea container filled with as much equipment as possible. Our number one goal is to build the clinic in Gaali while simultaneously fixing up the clinic in Kasaka. While the areas are both in a great need, Gaali has absolutely nothing at this point and this is why we have chosen to focus here and have Kasaka benefit from the residual effects of working in Gaali.

We are looking for any and all medical equipment. Supplies are great for the start-up, but our focus is on the sustainability portion. This is why collaboration within different sectors is important. We understand if you cannot help financially, but if you can help spread the word about One Seed and our goals, we can get our name out there and help out a wonderful community.
