story:
We are living in a world where masks have become mandated in most public areas. They not only protect us, but it also protects our loved ones and the public. Unfortunately, masks are not always easy to wear frequently. They can become uncomfortable, stuffy, damp and unsanitary. People have even expressed feelings of lightheadedness and migraines due to the restricted airflow.

 

VoGuard Droplet Blocking Test

 

VoGuard Particle Filtration Efficiency Test

 
 
 

We’ve noticed that disposable masks are…

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

+

 

Have you ever wondered how the super HD quality works on your television? That exact same technology was applied in our very own VoGuard filters. VoGuard wanted to make the filter as effective as possible by creating micro holes in polyester films—so users can be protected and breathe freely at the same time.

 

After continuous testing, Vault Creation was able to invent the Advanced Plasma Machine and etch micro-sized holes through its PATENTED invention.

 

Vault Creation used its technology to be the first in the world to etch 5 μm holes on a PET film—a material safe enough to be used in food packaging. Unlike typical masks that uses static electricity to filter, VoGuard blocks any particles that are larger than 5 μm including droplets that carry harmful particles. 

 

 

An accredited testing center based in Japan called KAKEN tested and proved that the filter in VoGuard blocked 99.9% of pollen.

 

This experiment is showing that VoGuard was able to block a majority of the fine dust, even with the extremely high air pressure—a notable result to consider from the experiment.

 

 

 

The filter allows free air flow. Even with the mask on, you can breathe comfortably. 

 

Compared to most masks which use three layers of filter, VoGuard only uses one layer of filter, making air easier to pass through.

 

The Testing & Research Institute performed numerous tests and experiments to prove the science behind this unique filter technology. The results show that VoGuard offers THREE TIMES MORE breathability than masks with melt blown filters.

       Melt Blown Filter Breathability: 349           /            VoGuard Filter Breathability: 1073.6

 

The Breathability Experiment shows that VoGuard allowed the most air flow when air was blown through the filters with an air compressor. 

 

 

VoGuard is washable, and you can easily clean it on the go.

Melt blown filters and cloth masks are classified as disposable because they can be easily contaminated. VoGuard is made from medical-grade PVC (safe for your skin), making it easy to clean with water and wipes. If you’re in a rush, it can even be sanitized with wipes.

 

The filters are polyester film perforated with 5 μm holes by the Advanced Plasma Machine. It is washable with water, sanitizing wipe or spray to be kept clean and sanitized.

 

 

 

 

You can save up to $329 per year by not purchasing disposable masks regularly. 

VoGuard was designed to be used semi-permanently so you don’t have to worry about hoarding all those disposable masks. We do recommend, however, that you switch out the filter every six months for sanitary purposes.

 

 

By using VoGuard, you are playing an important role in protecting the environment from additional pollution.

It helps reduce waste going into the environment with its cutting-edge reusable design. 

 

 

 

 

 

VoGuard is versatile and easy to take with you because it can be folded without being crumpled and destroyed.

It can even be washed on the go with sanitizer or wipes. You can carry it around anywhere!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Live, Immediate Thoughts after Usage

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The advanced etching technology in VoGuard’s filter allows us to create micro holes of less than 5μm that block droplets that may carry harmful particles including pollen and fine dusts —while allowing free air flow. 

 

 

Other masks that have valves do not filter out the air we breathe. VoGuard, on the other hand, filters both air that may carry harmful particles going in AND coming out.

 

You can even be creative and decorate your VoGuard to show your true style!

 

 

 

 

 

 

PLUS COMPLIMENTARY GIFT TO ALL BACKERS:

 

VoGuard has decided to give ALL BACKERS an anti-bacterial pouch as a complimentary gift! 

Thank you so much for all the support you guys have given us! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our CEO, Sang Jun Choi, established Vault Creation in 2015, and he began his research that led him to create the filter technology for our very own VoGuard.

Choi received his doctor’s medical degree in Material Science and Engineering from a renowned engineering university in South Korea. It is one of the leading private research universities in the country, dedicated to research and education in science and technology.

 

He succeeded in applying 10 μm etching on polyamide for the first time in the world in 2018, and was able to etch 5 μm in 2020—applying and registering 13 patents globally. 

Through this achievement, he saw the potential of using this patented technology in an area of air purification and published a paper on this subject in the Applied Science Journal in 2019.

When the unexpected pandemic rapidly spread across the globe earlier this year, we wanted to provide a way for individuals to wear masks comfortably and be protected at the same time. 

We reached out to several mask manufacturers, but these mask manufacturers were only using fabric or melt blown filters, and they were not able to understand that this thin layer of PET film can block particles as small as 5 μm. 

We soon came to a realization that this process would not be easy, but we did not give up! After long hours of research and consideration, CEO Sang Jun Choi determined that we could manufacture VoGuard ourselves if we combine our resources and put in viable effort. While it was challenging, we were able to succeed. We are now proud to present VoGuard to Kickstarter and our backers.

Our work is not done yet—our plan is to make a filter that can block particles, that can block harmful particles that are as small as 2.5 microns

Our Kickstarter campaign for VoGuard is the very first step we are taking on this journey, and we want to take that step with you—so we invite you to support VoGuard.

story:
A Life Story

 

The author of 'FANTASTIC VITALITY' is Raja Tamaran, a health and yoga teacher from Hawaii who has for the past forty years been exploring islands in the Pacific and Asia, specifically asking the question: Does paradise really exist? There is certainly much to say about this, having visited some very paradisical situations. However, from climbing coconut palms, drinking coconuts, and eating coconuts day in day out, the journey turned into a study of nutrition. More than a few years were spent gaining wisdom from a health guru at a fasting retreat in KohSamui,Thailand.  The first outcome of studies came ten years ago as the book; 'Secrets In The Coconut', (available on Amazon), tells just about everything there is to know about the tree of life and its fruit. Many recognize coconut as one of the greatest health foods on earth, although people in coconut land never focus on the nut alone, its' always part of a circle of nutrients.

Sensitivity and Perception

A second outcome of living on coconuts was development of a heightened degree of sensitivity and perception of effects of nutrients in the body. When studies turned to other nutrients, this sensitivity enabled discoveries. The discoveries are simple in nature, but add up to be a set of keys holding potential to bring greater health to all mankind.  Recognizing this value motivated the writing of 'FANTASTIC VITALITY Health Healing Rejuvenation'.  

The New Book

On one hand the book is very basic with familiar information, but then it takes one to the future of nutrition.  The writing is not overly technical, but easy reading for all ages. The 232 pages are organized as seven key nutrient categories, with many photos, several charts, multiple recipes, and significant tonic formulas.  All adding up to be nutrient chemistry that supports energetic physical renewal, or just say rejuvenation. Fantastic Vitality has valuable knowledge for people young and old, from the equator to the arctic circle, as a person can increase the bodies' rate of healing. Yet honestly, it is a question as to how long it will take for this health promoting information to be embraced by the general populace. It's difficult enough to communicate to all members of Indiegogo, let alone a tenth of mankind, who are not necessarily interested in higher nutrition.  So it will be health enthusiasts and Indiegogo explorers who gain first access to a simple set of keys with unique value...

                      

Why Indiegogo Funding

There are simple reasons for introducing our book here on a pre-order basis.  First, its a notable launchpad fitting our interest in direct sales to the public, rather than going through a publisher right away.  A prime reason for listing here is seeking enough orders of the first edition to cut printing costs.  Pre-sales of 250 paperback copies will enable us to have a first print run, while for ebooks there is no minimum. At launch time our plan is; two back to back campaigns, running from January 5th to April 30th.   It is also desirable that the book has a date of introduction, which is set for May 15th 2019 when shipment of the first printing should occur for ebooks and paperback copies.  At that time each individual who funds an order should receive an ebook within hours or paperback within two weeks. We will be shipping to backers in the USA from Hawaii, and backers in the rest of the world from Thailand.  If we have not obtained enough orders by March 30th we may revise the shipping date.  Release of the ebook will be coordinated with shipping of the printed version. Meanwhile, we will be working to advertise where ever possible, to raise orders and deliver when possible.  

Minamalist Campaign Maximus Ambitions

This may be considered a barebones campaign, for the simple reason no unrelated perks are being offered.  We seek support but not donations.  The book alone is the prize we are trading for funds, and our true ambitions are in health and healing of the world. Yes that's a tall order, but if we can sell enough books we can begin to contribute. World problems are becoming critical with population growth and global warming. Nutrition and a focus on health represents a large answer as knowledge can help people achieve greater health with less effort, resulting in greater happiness and intelligence. The course ahead is not only to sell 'Fantastic Vitality' in a variety of languages, but establish a school where people can be invited to experience the answers.   

Verile Potency

The book points to a circle of specific nutrients that support superior health, healing, and promote sexual virility and youthfulness.  There are several pages regarding the health of chi, with simple intelligence that will weigh against beliefs in exotic animal parts as sexual stimulants. When the book is translated into Chinese and sold in that nation, we are hopeful such information will help dissuade people from pushing wildlife to extinction.  

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

It is certainly a question as to how many people will see and respond to our campaign on Indiegogo.  For that reason we are inclined to create this exact same campaign on other crowd funding websites, and wherever possible.  Once we have the book printed we will move our campaign from funding to marketing category, and communicate with publishers.

OUR INDIEGOGO FLEXIBLE GOAL: $6,000 AND WHY​

This amount represents the price we are asking for a copy of the book times two hundred fifty orders.  Cost of shipping by airmail is several times cost of printing the book.  Writing a book is an act of faith, and after several years of no pay we are sincerely hoping for your order.  We also hope backers will have sincere interests in health and healing, or fund a copy of 'Fantastic Vitality' as a gift for someone. We promise this book is fulfilling, please tell everyone you know it is here...

story:
UPDATE:
Coverage from UVa: Startup Launches Crowd Funding Campaign
https://batten.virginia.edu/school/news/breathe...

We've created a patent pending process to produce fabric that can trap the most dangerous particulate matter at a cost and speed that was previously not possible.

Our technology relies on metal organic frameworks (MOFs), which are more effective and better for the environment than the polymer-based masks and scarves currently on the market.

To get our life-improving technology to the people of the world who need it the most as quickly as possible, our first product will be a scarf. Simple to design and manufacture, the HAVA scarf will set us on a path towards expanding into other wearable items, such as masks.

By creating an easy-to-wear, ergonomic product that can be used as a common clothing accessory we also hope to eliminate the stigma around  personal pollution filtration devices.
 

Our Partner

The Global Problem of Air Pollution

 

 

Outdoor air pollution is a major cause of death and disease globally. The health effects range from increased hospital admissions and emergency room visits, to increased risk of premature death.
 

Our Technology: Key Benefits

  •  MOF starting materials are inexpensive and degrade much faster than polymers, reducing the waste and additional plastic pollution accumulation.

  • By using MOFs in combination with natural fibers, such as cotton, hemp and bamboo, we are offering an alternative to the synthetic and sterile-looking products typically offered.

  • MOFs have the potential to capture harmful gas pollutants such as SOx and NOx that frequently accompany particulate matter emissions from combustion processes.


A Social Enterprise

Most air masks available for purchase are made from polymers, but these masks cannot be easily produced cheaply, hence the high ( > $ 1/mask) retail prices. Masks made from clothing fabrics are also available, but they don't effectively capture pollutants and gases.

Our scarf addresses both of those limitations, making it possible to serve vulnerable populations in the developing world. Initially we will partner with NGOs and humanitarian aide groups who can help us provide the world's poor with a truly effective way to protect themselves from toxic air. We are in talks with the United Nations and several other organizations to make this happen.

In the long term, we envision our's to be a double bottom line business. We'll have a social return on investment and a financial. In other words: do well by doing good.

 

The Team 

Prof. Gaurav Giri Co-founder + CTO

Gaurav graduated with a B.S. in Chemical Engineering from Caltech, a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from Stanford University and finished his postdoctoral work at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He has been a professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering at the University of Virginia since 2016, where his research group is focused on studying the fundamental processes behind metal organic framework thin film crystallization, and applications of metal organic frameworks.

Prof. Bala Mulloth Co-founder + CEO

Bala is a globally oriented educator and entrepreneur who has lived and worked in Asia, Europe and North America. His focus areas are innovation and social entrepreneurship and he is currently an Assistant Professor of Public Policy at the University of Virginia's Frank Batten School of Leadership and Public Policy.

Luke Huelsenbeck Co-founder + COO

Luke is currently working towards a PhD in Chemical Engineering. He brings several years of technology development experience from a diverse range of international start ups and R&D departments focused on a cleaner, brighter future. 

 

Way Forward 

Your donation will help us with the crucial next steps to bring HAVA scarves to the world.

  • January 2019: Move into wet lab space, purchase required equipment and confirm distribution partnerships.
  • February 2019: Tooling build-out, complete assembly testing and international quality control certifications.
  • March 2019: Part qualification and pre-production builds, pilot production and quality assurance.
  • April 2019:  Begin manufacturing of scarves.
  • May - June  2019: Begin order fulfillment and delivery.
                                            

More About How We Got Started

"When Gaurav Giri returned to his native country, Nepal, two summers ago to get married, he should have been walking on air. Instead, he was getting sick from it.

Had the air in Nepal always been this difficult to breathe, or had it gotten worse since he had last been home?

“You just couldn’t drive through the city with the windows down,” recalled Giri, an assistant professor of chemical engineering at the University of Virginia, who has lived in the United States since he was 14 and had last visited Nepal in 2011. “The air pollution was just too severe.”

That’s when Giri got the idea. Continue Reading..."
story_txt:
UPDATE:Coverage from UVa: Startup Launches Crowd Funding Campaignhttps://batten.virginia.edu/school/news/breathe...
We've created a patent pending process to produce fabric that can trap the most dangerous particulate matter at a cost and speed that was previously not possible.
Our technology relies on metal organic frameworks (MOFs), which are more effective and better for the environment than the polymer-based masks and scarves currently on the market.
To get our life-improving technology to the people of the world who need it the most as quickly as possible, our first product will be a scarf. Simple to design and manufacture, the HAVA scarf will set us on a path towards expanding into other wearable items, such as masks.
By creating an easy-to-wear, ergonomic product that can be used as a common clothing accessory we also hope to eliminate the stigma around  personal pollution filtration devices. 
Our Partner

The Global Problem of Air Pollution

 
 
Outdoor air pollution is a major cause of death and disease globally. The health effects range from increased hospital admissions and emergency room visits, to increased risk of premature death. 

Our Technology: Key Benefits


 MOF starting materials are inexpensive and degrade much faster than polymers, reducing the waste and additional plastic pollution accumulation.
By using MOFs in combination with natural fibers, such as cotton, hemp and bamboo, we are offering an alternative to the synthetic and sterile-looking products typically offered.
MOFs have the potential to capture harmful gas pollutants such as SOx and NOx that frequently accompany particulate matter emissions from combustion processes.


A Social Enterprise

Most air masks available for purchase are made from polymers, but these masks cannot be easily produced cheaply, hence the high ( > $ 1/mask) retail prices. Masks made from clothing fabrics are also available, but they don't effectively capture pollutants and gases.
Our scarf addresses both of those limitations, making it possible to serve vulnerable populations in the developing world. Initially we will partner with NGOs and humanitarian aide groups who can help us provide the world's poor with a truly effective way to protect themselves from toxic air. We are in talks with the United Nations and several other organizations to make this happen.
In the long term, we envision our's to be a double bottom line business. We'll have a social return on investment and a financial. In other words: do well by doing good.
 

The Team 

Prof. Gaurav Giri Co-founder + CTO
Gaurav graduated with a B.S. in Chemical Engineering from Caltech, a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from Stanford University and finished his postdoctoral work at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He has been a professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering at the University of Virginia since 2016, where his research group is focused on studying the fundamental processes behind metal organic framework thin film crystallization, and applications of metal organic frameworks.

Prof. Bala Mulloth Co-founder + CEO
Bala is a globally oriented educator and entrepreneur who has lived and worked in Asia, Europe and North America. His focus areas are innovation and social entrepreneurship and he is currently an Assistant Professor of Public Policy at the University of Virginia's Frank Batten School of Leadership and Public Policy.
Luke Huelsenbeck Co-founder + COO
Luke is currently working towards a PhD in Chemical Engineering. He brings several years of technology development experience from a diverse range of international start ups and R&D departments focused on a cleaner, brighter future. 
 

Way Forward 
Your donation will help us with the crucial next steps to bring HAVA scarves to the world.


January 2019: Move into wet lab space, purchase required equipment and confirm distribution partnerships.

February 2019: Tooling build-out, complete assembly testing and international quality control certifications.

March 2019: Part qualification and pre-production builds, pilot production and quality assurance.

April 2019:  Begin manufacturing of scarves.

May - June  2019: Begin order fulfillment and delivery.
